platform_adaptations.reddit: What safety protocols do you follow for sketchy deliveries? After reading through that horror story thread on r/doordash, I'm realizing how many drivers have encountered dangerous situations. For those who've been doing this a while, what are your non-negotiable safety rules? Personally, I've started: never entering customer homes, always keeping my car running, sharing live location with a friend on night shifts, and trusting my gut when something feels off—even if it means canceling. What am I missing? What protocols have actually saved you in a sketchy situation?
